Comment: Unwise. When black frees the way for the queen to b6, it must be played c3 (or c4) in return, to open the way for the queen to mimic black's move. I tried for this time another way, but, it didn't went so well...

Waiting for Nd5 or Nh5, to set the queen on g4. Qh3 was probably better, in the hindsight. A little slip like this can throw the game away. It is very tense, indeed.

I have to be very careful now, and get exactly what will be the dangerous tempoes, the unavoidable moves I'll have to do, and the weakness in c3 if I have to play b3.
Last developement move. h5 at once would have been too much to dare even for me.
The "surprise". This way I am threatening e4.
The "surprise". This way I am threatening e4.
No point in running away. Qxe4 was probably better, but black will have got too much for the pawn. Nxc3 was on his agenda.
I MISSED here Nxe4, with great shame from my part. RxNd7 compensates and e4 is hanging.
